column1: Nienna was a Queen of the Valar
column2: the sister of Mandos and Irmo
column3: acquainted with grief and sorrow but also pity and courage.

column2: she is ranked as one of the eight Aratar
column3: the most powerful of the Valar. Her element is grief
column4: ever mourning for the wounds of the world by evil. Those who listen to her learn wisdom and endurance in grief.

column1: Her Halls of Nienna are in the distant west
column2: close to the Halls of Mandos
column3: but on the western borders of the World and her windows look outward from the Walls of the World. She dwells alone and rarely travelled to the joyful city of Valmar; those in the Halls of Waiting who cried to her
column4: and she went more often to the halls of her brother Mandos to comfort and counsel them.

column1: All that is known about her appearance is that she wore a grey hood.: "cast back her grey hood"
Her part in the Music of the Ainur was one of deep sadness
column2: and from this grief entered the world in its beginning.
who was later to travel to Middle-earth as Gandalf

column1: Nienna played a part in the making of the Two Trees of Valinor; she wept on the mound of Ezellohar
column2: watering it with her tears. After the destruction of the Trees by Morgoth
column3: she once again wept on their wounded remains
column5: and helping to bring forth the last fruit and flower that were to become the Sun and the Moon.

column1: The pity of Nienna is most clearly seen in her support for Melkor when he sued for the pardon of the Valar. Though she spent her time in the world mourning for the destruction he has wreaked in Arda
column2: when he sued for release after his three ages of Captivity

column1: Nienna is a Quenya name which contains the word nie "tear".

column2: Nienna is referred to as the sister of Manwë and Morgoth.
